# criteria.phi_p { #pyLHD.criteria.phi_p }

`criteria.phi_p(arr, p=15, q=1)`

Calculate the phi_p Criterion

## Parameters

| Name   | Type          | Description                                                                                                                                                                                             | Default    |
|--------|---------------|---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------|------------|
| `arr`  | numpy.ndarray | A design matrix                                                                                                                                                                                         | _required_ |
| `p`    | int           | A positive integer, which is the parameter in the phi_p formula. The default is set to be 15. If (q) is 1, (dij) is the Manhattan (rectangular) distance. If (q) is 2, (dij) is the Euclidean distance. | `15`       |

## Returns

| Type   | Description                        |
|--------|------------------------------------|
| float  | A positive number indicating phi_p |

## Examples



Calculate the phi_p criterion for random_lhd with default settings
```{python}
import pyLHD
random_lhd = pyLHD.random_lhd(n_rows=10,n_columns=3)
pyLHD.phi_p(random_lhd)  
```
Calculate the phi_p criterion of random_lhd with p=50 and q=2 (Euclidean)
```{python}
pyLHD.phi_p(random_lhd,p=50,q=2) 
```
